title: Success Example
text: At ABC College, the withdrawal rate from an elementary physics course is 30% for any given term. This implies that, for any given term, 70% of the students stay in the class for the entire term. A "success" could be defined as an individual who withdrew.

title: Binomial Distributions
text: Since our distribution is Binomial, we can think of our distribution as being a series of Bernoulli trials. What would a success look like in a Bernoulli trial? Is it the same as a success in our Binomial trial?

title: Answer
text: With the example fresh in our minds, what is our final answer going to be?
choices: A school lunch not having fruit.
